A Class_specification_association is an association of a with a .
This assignment specifies that the related specification is relevant for the products of the . This serves as a potential characteristic of all products belonging to the .
The meaning of this association is specified further by the attribute association_type.
Effectivity information may be added to characterize the period when the specification is relevant within the , with that considered association type
the for which the is relevant.

ext_description.p: the association_type specifies the kind of availability of a particular in a .
Where applicable, the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'availability': the is a potential characteristic of any product belonging to a high level . It is not specified if this is an option or a standard; 'brown colour' or 'white colour' are available for a generic product of the instance 'Family 1'.

'identification': the is a characteristic that enables to distinguish the associated from other instances. This is a kind of non replaceable standard. This value is not applicable for a top level node in a hierarchy of instances. This identification is part of the identification of all sub classes of this ; '3' is the instance that distinguish all the sofas with 3 cushions from the 4 cushions sofas in the instance that includes 3 and 4 cushions sofas.

'non replaceable standard': the is a characteristic of all products belonging to the ; South East Asia climate zone is a non replaceable standard for a product that is produced for use in that particular geographic area.

'option': the instance is a characteristic of a product if explicitly chosen. The relevant instance replaces another instance of the same instance if the replaced instance is associated with the as replaceable standard; Additional features are common customization options proposed to the customer.

'replaceable standard': the is a default characteristic of the products belonging to the as long as no other of the same is chosen; 'lack painting' is a replaceable standard for instance 'Furniture family 1'; it can be replaced by other types of painting which is another instance of the same instance 'finishing'.

'part usage': the specifies a condition for the usage of particular parts in the products of the associated or of particular process plans or process operations to manufacture these products. The parts may be referred to as elements of an , or as instances of .

ext_description.p: In the cases 'part usage' and 'design case', the Class_specification_association shall be referenced by at least one instance.

A Product_class_relationship is a relationship between two instances of .
Instances of that are related to each other by a Product_class_relationship, do not inherit any characteristics from each other.

ext_description.p: the meaning of the relationship.
Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'derivation': the related is derived from the relating ;
'hierarchy': the relating is on a higher level in the hierarchy of instances than the related ;
'substitution': the related replaces the relating ;
'version sequence': the relating is the preceding version and the related is the following version.

example.p: The following is an example of hierarchical structure of instances, the hierarchical relationships being established with instances of Product_class_relationship with relation_type 'hierarchy':

ul.li: a high level instance ( = enterprise) may be used to define all the and instances for all instances of an enterprise with several brands and companies;
a second level instance ( = designer) may be used to group all products that are based on the same concept, the same designer; these products may belong to different brands;
a third level instance ( = product family) may be used to group all products that have a common base and a fixed set of characteristics (specification categories);

a fourth level instance ( = product type) may represent products that are offered to the market; this level of may be defined by the marketing department. A set of specifications sufficient to produce the product is associated with this level of . Within this association, a distinction is made between standard characteristics and options that have to be chosen or that may be chosen by the customer. the 'number of doors' is a standard characteristics. the 'colour' is an option that shall be choose by a customer. the 'additional features' are options that may be choose by a customer.

ext_description.p: A Specification is a characteristic of products to be proposed to customers or users.
ext_description.note: A Specification may be used to discriminate a product from other members of the same .
ext_description.p: A Specification refers to a that completes the semantics of the Specification.
ext_description.example: 'green', 'white', or 'black' are examples for specifications belonging to the of type 'colour'. 'set of 3 drawers' or 'set of 5 drawers' are examples for specifications belonging to the of type 'additional feature'.
ext_description.note: A Specification may be a characteristic of the members of more than one using instances.
A Specification in combination with a may be used to define under which conditions a product is used for a product of a .

a boolean value that specifies whether this Specification represents a package of specifications. Such a Specification combines those specifications that shall be offered to the market as a set.

In the case where package is 'true', there shall be exactly one per considered, that refers to this Specification as . The Specification instances that are members of the package, shall be identified within a referred to by the as .
ext_description.note: Commercial packages may be defined by the marketing department.
Usually the members of a package belong to distinct specification categories.
ext_description.example: A sports package for a of cars contains sports seats, a special steering wheel, special tires and wheels. A winter package contains heated front seats, heated windshield washers, heated exterior mirrors, and special tires.

ext_description.p: A Specification_category is the identification of a set of specifications serving the same purpose.
ext_description.example: The category 'colours', containing the specifications 'green' and 'white' and the category 'additional features', containing the specifications 'set of 3 drawers', 'set of 5 drawers', are examples for a Specification_category.

ext_description.p: a boolean value that specifies whether the specifications within the Specification_category are mutually exclusive for the production of a particular product.
A value of 'true' indicates that the referenced objects are mutually exclusive.
ext_description.example: 'additional features' is a non mutually exclusive Specification_category if 'set of 3 drawers' and 'door with mirror' are instances in this category. 'colours' is a Specification_category with an implicit_exclusive_condition since usually the product can have only one 'colour'.
ext_description.p: More complex conditions can be handled using instances of .
the identifier of the Specification_category that shall be unique.
ext_description.note: The scope of uniqueness is usually dependent on the form of implementation. The scope of uniqueness may be constrained by the extent of a physical file or a database.

ext_description.p: a text that provides additional information about the Specification_category.
ext_description.example: The description 'trim' may characterize a Specification_category for instances of that control quality and colour of the finishing of the product including door panels and upholstery.

ext_description.p: A Specification_category_hierarchy is used to build up hierarchical structures of instances of .
ext_description.example: The "Type of cover", for sofas, contains the specifications: "Leather" and "Alcantara". The "Leather cover kind", containing the specifications "Buffalo cover" and "Kidskin cover", may be a sub_category of the "Type of cover".
ext_description.p: The fact that a is a sub_category of another does not involve that this sub_category inherits the associations of the super_category with product classes.

ext_description.p: A Specification_expression is a combination of instances formed with Boolean operations.
ext_description.example: If color "Light blue" of sofa when selected with "Alcantara" coating requires a special finishing operation, a Specification_expression with the expression "Light blue" AND "Alcantara", will be created to be used to define a use case of that particular process operation.

ext_description.p: A Specification_inclusion is the representation of the statement that specifies that the application of a or of a implies the inclusion of an additional or .

ext_description.example: A Specification_inclusion, associated with a "sofa", may represent the fact that the "Leather" implies the : "3 seats" OR ("2 seats" AND "headrests"). Such an constraint would imply that if a customer choses a leather 2-seats sofa, he would get also headrests.
